subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ghost Box in a Faraday Cage type enclosure
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
A Faraday cage is supposed to stop all electromagnetic fields from 
entering it. They are useful in aligning equipment when you don't want 
any external RF present.

You're right; in a Faraday cage you would not be able to hear any radio 
stations. Frank's box probably wouldn't work as expected in a Faraday 
cage.

Zack

On Sun, 9 Nov 2008, threadsintyme@... wrote:

> Mike didn't cover the reasoning behind the Faraday Box in his YOUTUBE 
> video...is it to prevent unwanted signals to come through? Seems like 
> the Faraday Box could be self defeating...IE, if you are expecting 
> radios signals to "come through", how can they?
> Again, this leads back to the questioning whether it is the signals or 
> the noise and the effects that spirits use to communicate with? IF 
> spirits are using EVP's to communicate! I am still open to the 
> possibility that spirits are. Doesn't mean the spirits ARE...LOL.
> Al
>
> -- "ourobouros2k2" <ourobouros2k2@...> wrote:
>
> This would seem to illustrate the divergence between schools of
> thought with traditional evp and itc/rtsc. While using a faraday cage
> to to prevent spurious and unwanted RF signals from contaminating a
> microphone would be helpful for traditional evp, would it not be
> counterproductive for box type ITC/RTSC? I am not trying to be
> sarcastic or anything, I am just wondering if the idea here is to
> ensure that if anything did make it through that it would most likely
> be genuine? I would be afraid that the RF shielding would be too
> effective thus blocking communication with a linear sweep box. If you
> did get communication from a box in a faraday cage, it would certainly
> make the skeptics and cynics be forced to present new arguments.
>
> thanks,
> Andy
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)"
> <michaelcoletta@...> wrote:
>>
>> While reading a book about spirit communication, there was a chapter
>> which referenced the Faraday Cage. So... after reading it I decided to
>> try out what the book suggested and placed my Radio Shack Hack 12-470
>> Ghost Box into my microwave oven (in the OFF position) and ran a sweep
>> in the AM and FM mode.
>> The AM mode did receive much less but a few audio snippets did make
>> their way through. The FM mode was a different story. No frequencies
>> at all made it through... just white noise as each FM frequency was
>> reached during the sweep.
>> As I always do... I made a short video of both modes being sweeped.
>> You can see it, here:
>> http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQwYmi70-qw
>>
>> Thanks,
>> - Mike (UFO Geek)
